resources.string: You see your friend, Georgina, in the back of the bus. You go join her. A strange looking individual asks you if he can borrow a pen. You hand it to him while listening to Georgina\'s long story about the boy she likes. A few minutes pass and the bus stops at some train tracks. Suddenly, your eyes start watering, what is that horrible smell? The individual who borrowed your pen opens up the emergency exit at the back of the bus and jumps out, laughing along the way. The whole bus smells like rotten eggs. Apparently, he used your pen to open up a giant stink bomb on the bus. Finally the chaos settles and the bus is cleaned out and reboarded.

You climb onto the bus and greet the bus driver. You notice a strange individual in the back whispering to your friend Georgina, you\'d like to talk to Georgina but something about that hoodlum doesn\'t seem right. Georgina clutches her bag tightly and moves away from the stranger, as does the other individuals sitting near him. You sit in the front row. The bus ride proceeds smoothly and arrives at the school.

You have chosen to walk to school. As you leave your house, you see your friends off in the distance. A car pulls up and blocks their view of you while they turn the corner. You contimplate whether you\'d get to school faster if you caught up with them, or if you walked alone. Which would be the better choice today?
